p: The administration of extracts at 125 and 500 mg/kg body weight to rats resulted in an increase in body weight over time similar to the control group, which indicates that the extracts were not acutely toxic. The extracts of S. punctata, A. pulcherrima, and A. aspera did not acutely affect body weight at a given dose 2000 mg/kg body weight in rats. These supports the safety of these extracts at a given dose in rats, which resulted an increase in body weight over time similar to the control group. However, the administrations of C. murale and R. abyssinicus extracts at dose 2000 mg/kg were associated with weight loss compared to their initial weight, although it was not significant ( Fig. 1C).
